description: Robert Chandler It is conservative, for instance, for Orwell to see horror in the world he created   where history was rewritten, paintings were repainted,   and statues were renamed.  Also reflected in the term "Tory Anarchist" is the idea that a sign of intelligence is being able to believe in two contradicting principles at the same time.   Children have great difficulty living with contradiction and ambiguity.  They are always demanding that everything be one way or the other.  This is exactly why the left is essentially childish.  They don't understand that there are contradictions in life for good reasons.  And the sign of maturity is being able to live with ambiguity.  Ambiguity is the state of nature.  God, or if you prefer, nature, creates predators and prey, lone wolves and herds of buffalo.   They all have their place in the world, and if one or other of them were to disappear,   nature would be out of balance and we all Life would suffer.

Robert Chandler It is a contradiction that tells a truth.  If Orwell were a true socialist, he would not mind what he discovered.   That Socialism always has leads to tyranny of one degree or another.   He would not have troubled himself to write a novel of great concern to expose this truth.  Socialists and leftists in general are quite happy with tyranny if it enforces policies they want.

description: Robert Chandler  shared a  link .

Robert Chandler Nikki Moonitz  asked a question about the relationship of slavery versus other issues in the Civil War.  Nikki, Your question underlines certain factors about who really controls the country that are at the heart of our present conflict today.  States rights and slavery were intertwined. But So had been other issues including tariffs-all of which had risen to crisis levels in the 1820s and 1830s  It all came to a head under Andrew Jackson, a Southerner from Tennessee and a slave owner himself,    when South Carolina was threatening secession over the issues of nullification and tariffs.  Jackson, who had been old enough to fight in the revolutionary war was an ardent Unionist.  By the time of the Civil War 30 years later,   almost no one was still alive who had lived through the revolution so union fervor was not as powerful in the south,   and abuses from the north of 60 years made secession a more thinkable choice at least emotionally to many Southerners.  Eventually, Jackson stared down the secessionists and outmaneuvered them.   But Civil War War came perilously close to happening in 1833.    And slavery was not the issue at that time.   Slavery was much more in the fore in 1860 when Lincoln was elected.  Slavery was not in danger of being abolished at that time   but it's expansion was being restricted so it couldn't go into the western territories and free states.  So, yes slavery was an issue and the most prominent one.  But so was state sovereignty and the relationship between the states and the central government.  The Southern states had felt for decades that their liberty was being more more constricted, and that they were in danger of being permanently dominated by the industrial urban / financially dominant north.  A fear that came true and from which the South has only somewhat escaped in the last couple of decades.  All the states between New York and California suffer from the dominance of media power which is located in New York and Los Angeles.  This is no small thing, and it is much of the reason we feel like we are on the brink of another kind of Civil War right now.

description: Robert Chandler Communists vs Fascists  Who do you like best?  Yes, well the Soviet union called itself "anti-fascist".  But they were no better. And in terms of numbers of people worldwide killed by Communism, Fascism is in the second ranks.   Of course the difference between 80 or 100 million versus 300 or a half a billion human beings,  is not a meaningful calculus.   Fascists and Communists are horrors beyond all comprehension.  Yet somehow we consider Nazis worse than Commies. Why choose?  People also continually forget that the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany were allies until the middle of 1941.  They both invaded Poland at the same time from opposite directions and divided it up between them.  When Hitler invaded Russia, it was a shock that caught Stalin totally offguard leaving him paralyzed with fear for six weeks, never leaving his bed.

description: Robert Chandler Brian St Cyr  Brian, do you think today is for fucking forever?  Do you realize how profoundly the world has changed in just 220 or so years since the invention of the steam engine?  Do you realize how incredibly the world has  changed since 1900 and the advent of internal combustion engines, the airplane, electricity, radio, and all the rest?  Do you realize how much the world has changed in 35 years since personal computers became widespread?  The world changes, civilizations disappear, knowledge and technologies are gained, but also lost.  How many people do you think have a floppy disc drive that they used to use every day in the 1980s?  I have Microsoft WORD files from the early 90s that are unreadable now. Current versions of EORD can't open them.   I know and understand technology far more deeply than you because I've been writing about it - selling it, promoting it, popularizing it -  on behalf of clients like Apple, Microsoft, IBM, National Semiconductor, Advanced Micro Devices, and many more since before you were born.  You get so mesmerized by one fact, that you can't see the wider world of fact.   Your ignorance of history and understanding of human kind make you blind.
